comment: This was for class met 4112. Keep in mind this class is mainly for graduating seniors yet he had unreachable expectations even for the brightest of students. Will pick on you too. I am graduating with honors and have never come close to failing a class yet I am with him because he demands 30 minutes per test and a 70 test average or class failed

Honestly worst professor I've ever taken. Not because he doesn't know what he teaches but because I truly believe that he is not alright up in there. He had fluctuating mood swings, and frankly does not respect those that do not agree with his mannerisms. He needs to get his act together in terms of communication, despite being a good lecturer

Pretty meh, and don't be too noticable otherwise he'll pick at you for the rest of the semester. Not to mention the guy let some dude come in 30 minutes late to a test but when I tried to get in 15 minutes (I literally called him twice about how bad traffic was 30 minutes before the test) he wouldn't let me take it(girl btw).

Professor Kennedy is an excellent professor.  He has lots of real world experience and uses it to help teach his students. He is very strict when wanting students to be in class and on time. Tests and quizzes are always straight forward. He always let us know what we needed to know before we took the test for the chapters. Would easily take again.

I have had him for a couple of classes and he will definitely prepare you for the real world. He is very experienced in the engineering field and wants all his students to succeed. It is not an easy A though, you will have to put the effort in, but it will be worth the outcome.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dont be late! Do well and he will acknowledge it. Hes very adamant about wanting his class to succeed and is tough on the class because he knows how tough theyll need to be once they graduate.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Tough but fair professor, gives lots of real world advice and lessons. He can be very strict and particular about small things like being on time so be prepared. Class was mainly lectures with lots of reading assignments, 4 tests, and a final group essay and presentation. You will learn a lot but be ready to work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy
